snippet: A judge accused Woodley Ethéart, an associate of President Michel Martelly, of running a kidnapping ring said to have abducted 17 people, but a prosecutor said the charges should be dropped.
abstract: Woodley Etheart, former music promoter with ties to Haitian Pres Michel Martelly, is indicted on charges of running kidnapping ring in Haiti that abducted 17 people and was involved in killing of police officer; surrogate prosecutor overseeing case recommends dropping charges, prompting human rights activists to point to government influence of prosecutors.

byline.original: By ANDRE PAULTRE and FRANCES ROBLES
byline.contributor: André Paultre reported from Port-au-Prince, and Frances Robles from Miami.

lead_paragraph: A judge accused Woodley Ethéart, an associate of President Michel Martelly, of running a kidnapping ring said to have abducted 17 people, but a prosecutor said the charges should be dropped.

headline.main: Ex-Promoter in Haiti Charged in Kidnapping Ring
headline.print_headline: Ex-Promoter in Haiti Charged in Kidnapping Ring
